author: louissealey1
title: Barcelona director refuses to rule out summer transfer move for Arsenal star Hector Bellerin
text:
Hector Bellerin could be targeted by Barcelona this summer (Picture: Getty) Barcelona sporting director Robert Fernandez has refused to rule out a move for Arsenal star Hector Bellerin at the end of the season.
Spain international Bellerin, who has made 29 appearances for the Gunners this season, has been strongly linked with a move to the La Liga giants.
CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday Fernandez confirmed Barcelona are evaluating their options in the right-back position and said the club would not hesitate if a player they believe would bolster their squad became available.
When asked whether Bellerin, 22, would be targeted by the Spanish giants, Fernandez said: ‘It is a position that we are evaluating.
‘There are many options and we will decide what we think is the best. If the market helps us, we will always try to improve, why not?
Bellerin has become an important player for Wenger (Picture: Getty) ‘But I do not want to talk about these things now, better to think about the titles we can win this year.’
Bellerin has become an integral member of Arsene Wenger’s side since signing from Barcelona’s youth system in 2011.
The rapid full-back was sent out on loan to Watford in 2013 but has earned a regular starting berth under Wenger in the last two seasons.
